edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2.ActiveAgent
      • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2.Enemy

  • public class Enemy
extends ActiveAgent
    This class represents the fields and methods for an Enemy in the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Enemy(int itemType)
      The constructor for the class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dropItem()
      This method calls Item.reassignTo(int) which changes the item type to "none" after the Player picks up the Item.
      java.lang.String getItem()
      This method returns a String representation of the type of item that the Enemy holds.
      void giveWeapon()
      This method assigns a Gun to Enemy based on the value of spawnWeapon indexed at weaponSpot.
      void respawn(int itemType)
      This method works with an integer parameter to reassign an Item to Enemy when it respawns in an encounter past the first.

      • Methods inherited from class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2.ActiveAgent

        assignWeapon, getGun, getHP, isAlive, isDead, restoreHP, shoot, takeDamage

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(int itemType)
        The constructor for the class. It takes an integer and assigns a default Item to Enemy based on the value it holds. It calls the constructor for ActiveAgent passing in an integer for the hitPoints field. It also creates 100 nodes for the spawnWeapon list and fills it with a 0, 1, or 2, shuffles it, and assigns the weapon based on what weaponSpot lands on.
        Parameters:
        itemType - Integer representation of the item to be held at creation.

    • Method Detail

      • giveWeapon

        public void giveWeapon()
        This method assigns a Gun to Enemy based on the value of spawnWeapon indexed at weaponSpot.

      • respawn

        public void respawn(int itemType)
        This method works with an integer parameter to reassign an Item to Enemy when it respawns in an encounter past the first. It also reissues a new Gun as well.
        Parameters:
        itemType - Integer representation of the type of item held.

      • getItem

        public java.lang.String getItem()
        This method returns a String representation of the type of item that the Enemy holds.
        Returns:
        The type of the Item in String form.

      • dropItem

        public void dropItem()
        This method calls Item.reassignTo(int) which changes the item type to "none" after the Player picks up the Item.
